intro: Tylloma gnaphalioides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has small, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring and are followed by small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Tylloma gnaphalioides is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to tolerate salty and windy conditions.
